content:
• Thursday, March 23, 2017
  • BLCM

    Bellicum Pharmaceuticals slipping after pricing 5M-share offering

    • Bellicum Pharmaceuticals (BLCM -10.2%) tumbled today following news yesterday of its 5M-share equity offering, and is off another 1.6% after hours on news it's priced that offering.
    • The company has priced the sale at $12/share. The stock price fell to $12.90 in regular hours, from yesterday's close of $14.37, and is quoting at $12.69 in postmarket action.
    • The offering is expected to close next Wednesday; Citigroup and Jefferies are lead book-running managers.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 PM | 5 Comments
  • JD

    JD.com +2.3% as Pac Crest launches at Outperform

    • JD.com (JD +2.3%) rose today on bullish sentiment from Pacific Crest, which launched shares at Outperform with an eye toward Chinese strength in e-commerce.
    • Pac Crest also launched Alibaba at Outperform today.
    • JD.com benefits from its image for authentic products (in a market torn by charges of counterfeiting) as well as logistics strength, says analyst Hans Cheng.
    • The company said earlier this month it would spin off its finance business for $2.1B, creating a better competitive front to Alibaba's Ant Financial, a positive according to Cheng: "We see sustainable profitability around the corner driven by margin expansion and an anticipated JD Finance spin-off."
    • He has a price target of $40, implying 28% upside in shares from today's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:07 PM
  • WDC

    Western Digital, Seagate gain after hours post-Micron reporting

    • Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) +3.2%, Seagate Technology (NASDAQ:STX) +1.15%.
    • Earlier (March 23, 2017): Micron Technology +9%; Q3 2017 outlook substantial
     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM | 7 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: MU +10.1%. HTGM +9.4%. QTNT +6.0%. WDC +3.0%. GLOG +3.0%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: GME -11.5%. SPWH -9.5%. MTW -4.8%. MYL -3.7%. CBS -2.0%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 6 Comments
  • ARRS

    Arris +3.9% as it updates guidance for 2017, long term

    • While the market as a whole took a turn for the worse amid a congressional delay in healthcare bill voting, Arris (ARRS +3.9%) built strength into the afternoon after an event where it provided updated guidance.
    • Citing a "strong finish to 2016" along with "capital pull-in creating a soft first quarter 2017," the company says Q1 will end up at the low end of guidance. But it now expects non-GAAP revenues for the full year of $6.615B-$6.83B (vs. consensus expectation for $6.7B).
    • It's also forecasting 2017 non-GAAP EPS of $2.40-$2.60, in line with consensus for $2.51. GAAP EPS is forecast to $0.61-$0.81 vs. analyst expectations for $0.60.
    • For beyond 2017, Arris says it's well positioned in the market with industry spending coming on such initiatives as DOCSIS 3.1 deployments (scaling up in the second half), multi-year fiber deep projects and advanced home networking, among others. It also cites major growth opportunities from the Ruckus/Brocade acquisition.
    • In the long term, it's expecting the service provider CPE business will remain steady and the Networks business growing in mid-single digits, with the Ruckus Wireless and Brocade Switching business growing 5-10% a year.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • MU

    Micron Technology +9%; Q3 2017 outlook substantial

    • Q2 2017 results – revenue $4.65B (+58.7% Y/Y, in line), EPS $0.90 ($0.05 above estimates), gross margin 38.5% (vs. 26% Q/Q, 20.4% Y/Y), net income $1.03B (vs. $335M Q/Q, $12M Y/Y), DRAM average selling prices +21% Q/Q, trade NAND sales volumes +18% Q/Q, capital expenditures investments $1.17B, cash, marketable investments and restricted cash $4.58B
    • Q3 2017 projections – revenue $5.2B-$5.6B (consensus $4.7B), EPS $1.43-$1.57 (consensus $0.89), gross margin 44%-48%, operating expenses $560M-$610M, operating income $1.8B-$2B
    • Micron Technology CEO Mark Durcan spotlights strong demand and limited supply for NAND and DRAM, as well as advancements the company's made regarding cost reductions.
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:MU) $28.85
    • Press release / conference call / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM | 103 Comments
  • RXDX

    Ignyta to explore strategic options regarding cancer candidate taladegib; shares up 7% after hours

    • Ignyta (NASDAQ:RXDX) perks up 7% after hours on light volume in response to its announcement that it has amended its 2015 license agreement with Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) allowing it to pursue strategic alternatives (i.e, the best development path) for small molecule taladegib, in development for the treatment of a range of cancers.
    • Specifically, the company will explore/assess the best development avenues for single-agent oral taladegib and the topical formulation via sub-licensing or selling the franchise to dermatology-focused companies with an interest in superficial, nodular and advanced basal cell carcinoma. It adds that unnamed firms have already expressed interest in the assets.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • GME

    Weak profit guidance sends GameStop lower

    • GameStop (NYSE:GME) reports comparable sale fell 16.3% in Q4 amid what the company calls "weak" video game demand.
    • Comparable sales were down 20% in the U.S. during the quarter.
    • New hardware sales declined 29% and new software sales fell off 19%. Pre-owned sales dropped 6.7% to $680.6M to account for 22.3% of all sales vs. 20.7% last year.
    • A bright spot for GameStop in Q4 was the collectibles category, with sales up 28% Y/Y to $212M.
    • GameStop expects FY17 revenue of -2% to +2% and FY18 EPS of $3.10 to $3.40 vs. $3.72 consensus. "As we continue our transformation plan, we will also be focused on managing SG&A spend, rationalizing our global store portfolio, and maximizing free cash flow generation to drive shareholder value," says CEO Paul Raines.
    • Previously: GameStop beats by $0.09, misses on revenue (March 23)
    • Shares of GameStop are down 7.97% AH to $22.05.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 38 Comments
  • STWD

    Starwood Property -2% on convertible note offering

    • Starwood Property (NYSE:STWD) is selling $200M of convertible notes due 2023. Proceeds will be used over time to purchase outstanding 4.55% convertible notes due next year.
    • Shares -1.95% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 11 Comments
  • GLOP

    GasLog Partners to buy LNG carrier from GasLog Ltd. for $219M

    • GasLog Partners (NYSE:GLOP) agrees to buy the GasLog Greece liquefied natural gas carrier from GasLog Ltd. (NYSE:GLOG) for $219M.
    • GLOP says the deal supports its guidance to grow unitholder distributions at a 10%-15% compound annual rate, and would result in an annualized distribution of $2.09 per unit or higher by Q4 2017.
    • The vessel is currently on a long-term time charter with a Royal Dutch Shell subsidiary through March 2026.
    • GLOP +1.6%, GLOG +3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 16 Comments
  • SPWH

    Sportsman's Warehouse drops sharply after earnings miss

    • Sportsman's Warehouse Holdings (NASDAQ:SPWH) reports same-store sales fell 5.2% in FQ4.
    • The company says the anniversity of the San Bernardino tragedy and a strong level of executive orders a year ago created a difficult comparison.
    • Gross profit fell 40 bps to 33.6% during the quarter. Net income as a percentage of sales decreased 70 bps to 4.8%.
    • Sportsman's Warehouse expects to open 12 stores this fiscal year. Guidance is for revenue of $150M to $155M and EPS of -$.06 to -$0.08.
    • Previously: Sportsmans Warehouse misses by $0.02, misses on revenue (March 23)
    • Shares of SPWH are down 16.30% in AH trading after jumping 7.94% before the bell.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 4 Comments
  • MU

    Micron Technology beats by $0.05, revenue in-line

    • Micron Technology (NASDAQ:MU): FQ2 EPS of $0.90 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $4.65B (+58.7% Y/Y) in-line.
    • Shares +3.9%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 123 Comments
  • CNSL

    Consolidated, FairPoint Communications rise with merger vote on track

    • Consolidated Communications (CNSL +1.4%) and FairPoint Communications (FRP +1.9%) have seen gains today after winning the dismissal of a suit over stock issuance tied to the two companies' planned merger.
    • A preliminary injunction issued in the case of Vento v. Currey et al. threatened to delay a special meeting of Consolidated stockholders set for next Tuesday.
    • In its filing, Consolidated noted it supplemented disclosures to add additional information on fees due to be paid to adviser Morgan Stanley, and says the injunction was vacated and the lawsuit dismissed.
    • The special meeting on march 28 will go on as scheduled, the company says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • DG

    Credit Suisse negative on Dollar General

    • Credit Suisse issues a harsh outlook on Dollar General (NYSE:DG).
    • "DG’s long-term growth algorithm looks unachievable, as increasing competition and rising cost pressures should weigh on earnings for some time," writes analyst Edward Kelly.
    • "While Q4 beat low expectations, the update highlighted underlying concerns related to sales momentum, margin sustainability, and the logic behind ramping openings to 1,000 stores per year. We believe DG will ultimately be forced to reset expectations and disappoint a street consensus that has assumed a reacceleration to 10% annual growth after a flat 2017," he adds.
    • CS lowers the retailer to an Underperform rating and lowers its price target to $62.
    • Last week, Dollar General said that it expects same-store sales to be up 0% to 2% this year.
    • On a strong day for the retail sector, shares of Dollar General are down 2.50% to $68.92.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 10 Comments
  • AAL

    American Airlines rallies after positive take from Stifel

    • American Airlines Group (NASDAQ:AAL) is up 2.70% after Stifel Nicolaus adds the airline company to its Select List of favored stocks.
    • The Stifel team is convinced that investors are underestimating the power of the American frequent flier program to generate revenue. The frequent flier revenue stream could total $2.7B in 2018, estimates the firm. Perhaps just as important, FF revenue is "immune" from added capacity or weaker pricing, advises Stifel.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM | 5 Comments
  • SC

    Santander Consumer -3% after Fed sanctions

    • At issue are "deficiencies" in consumer compliance that the company had been ordered to fix in 2015.
    • The action raises dividend uncertainty for Santander (SC -3%), says Wells Fargo's Joel Houck, who previously saw the chance of an H2 payout as a potential catalyst for the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: OIBR.C +11%. AXTI +10%. VRNS +8%. AVID +8%. DRWI +7%.
    • Losers: EGAN -10%. CPSH -9%. QUIK -9%. OTC:PRKR -8%. STRM -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • DWDP

    Reuters: EU regulators may soon OK Dow-DuPont, ChemChina-Syngenta deals

    • European Union antitrust regulators are set to clear the merger of Dow Chemical (DOW +1.7%) and DuPont (DD +1.7%) as well as ChemChina's takeover bid for Syngenta (SYT +1.2%), Reuters reports.
    • The European Commission reportedly could announce its approvals for both companies at the same time either on Monday or Tuesday; such a joint merger announcement would be rare but it could make sense in this case since both companies are in the agrochemicals sector.
    • The EU antitrust enforcer has set an April 4 deadline for the Dow-DuPont deal, and April 12 for the ChemChina-Syngenta deal.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 20 Comments
  • EEP

    Enbridge Energy Partners +3.5% as Morgan Stanley rates Overweight

    • Enbridge Energy Partners (EEP +3.6%) is higher after Morgan Stanley awards it an Overweight rating, even though a distribution cut of as much as 40% is likely when the MLP eventually completes its strategic review.
    • Stanley sees a compelling valuation after the units have dropped ~30% since EEP updated investors on its plans in January, with more upside potential depending on how the distribution cut is implemented by parent company Enbridge (ENB -0.7%).
    • The firm thinks the strategic review could help EEP if ENB is further supportive by, for example, offering additional and possibly over-equitized drops at attractive multiples with the take-back of units, revamping joint funding agreements, or eliminating the modest incentive distribution rights burden.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM | 32 Comments
  • TRIP

    Tripadvisor jumps amid buyout chatter

    • Tripadvisor (TRIP +2.6%) rallies on trader chatter that Priceline could be interested in a takeover. The TRIP-PCLN scenario has been bandied about a few times in the past without a deal being struck.
    • Shares of Tripadvisor peaked today at $42.61 vs. a 52-week range of $40.45 to $71.69.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 1 Comment

  • Energy/Material - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: CNXC +9%. ECR +8%. WLB +7%. WG +6%. CRK +5%.
    • Losers: OEC -10%. ASM -6%. CDEV -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • RACE

    All-time high for Ferrari in Milan and New York

    • Ferrari (RACE +4%) rallies to a new all-time high in New York after Citi boosts the automaker to Buy from Neutral.
    • The investment firm thinks Ferrari has more room to increase prices and could boost volume by as much as 100% in a decade.
    • Citi on Ferrari: "The allure of the Ferrari brand makes them behave like a Giffen good, and we don’t foresee any risk to their exclusive appeal. Since 1997 Porsche volumes have grown sevenfold, but pricing of its core 911 has improved relative to mass market models. Over the same period Ferrari volumes have grown twofold, while the number of wealthy individuals has also doubled. To our minds Ferrari can grow volumes considerably with limited risk."
    • Ferrari closed up 4.35% in Milan at its all-time high of €65.90
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM | 2 Comments
  • VLRX

    Valeritas stumbles out of the gate, shares down 25%

    • IPO Valeritas Holdings (NASDAQ:VLRX) is having rough first day. Shares are down from from the offer price of $10 which was reduced 33% from the midpoint of its original target of $14 - 16.
    • An earlier data snafu showed shares up almost 135%.
    • Previously: Valeritas readies downsized IPO (March 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • SPWH

    Sportsman's Warehouse rallies into earnings

    • Sportsman's Warehouse Holdings (SPWH +6.2%) breaks higher ahead of the company's earning report due out after the bell.
    • Analysts expect the company to report revenue of $229M and EPS of $0.27.
    • Even with today's bump, shares of Sportsman's Warehouse are down 47% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • SITC

    Mall and shopping center REITs break losing string

    • The roughed-up group is a wall of green today, helped along by a UBS upgrade to Neutral from Sell for DDR (DDR +2.3%). Analyst Nick Yulico says the bad news for retail landlords is likely priced in at this point, and he has hopes for the new management team at DDR.
    • Other movers include: Kimco (KIM +2.3%), Federal Realty (FRT +1.8%), Whitestone (WSR +2.3%), Kite Realty (KRG +2.4%), CBL & Associates (CLB), Simon Property (SPG +1.9%), General Growth (GGP +1.9%), PREIT (PEI +3.7%).
    • Previously: Another rough session for retail REITs as KeyBanc downgrades, Sears warns (March 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 8 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: HTGM +98%. FLXN +36%. VSR +26%. CGIX +19%. VBLT +16%. SVU +13%. FIVE +13%. CSTM +12%. PLUG +12%. PENN +11%.
    • Losers: CERU -28%. TNDM -24%. ATEC -22%. HTBX -16%. MDGS -15%. QUIK -12%. VHC -12%. TOPS -12%. MBRX -11%. ATOS -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: PVH +8%. SPWH +8%. SNAK +8%. MLHR +6%. BREW +5%.
    • Losers: VNCE -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • BHC

    FDA OKs Medicure subsidiary Apicore's generic Xenazine

    • The FDA approves Apicore's Abbreviated New Drug Application (ANDA) for tetrabenazine tablets, the generic equivalent of Valeant Pharmaceuticals' (VRX +2.8%) Xenazine, indicated for the treatment of involuntary movements of Huntington's disease. The product was recently launched by development partner TAGI Pharma.
    • Apicor is majority owned by Medicure (OTCPK:MCUJF +3.9%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM | 85 Comments
  • HMY

    Harmony Gold hit by wildcat strike at South Africa mine

    • Harmony Gold (HMY -4.5%) sinks on news of a wildcat strike at its Kusasalethu mine in South Africa, which the company says was encouraged by the AMCU union in response to the disciplinary procedures against 40 employees following the illegal sit-in at the mine in January.
    • Kusasalethu has been a flash point for labor violence and strikes in recent years, threatening the viability of the mine and underlining the social risks of mining in South Africa.
    • The mine has ~4,500 employees and produced ~124K oz. of gold in FY 2016.
    • Separately, HMY said yesterday that it aims to hike its yearly gold production to 1.5M oz. from the current 1.1M oz. over the next three years, as it undertakes expansions at its operations in South Africa, the rest of Africa and Papua New Guinea while also potentially acquiring low-cost, high-value assets.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 5 Comments
  • ASNA

    Retail stocks churn higher

    • Strong earnings report from Five Below and PVH seem to be swaying investors in the retail sector. The two late reporters gave a deeper look at Q1 trends than some of the earlier earnings disclosers. Investors may also be factoring in the heated battle in Congress over health care reform as an indication that the border tax proposal could face an uphill climb.
    • Today's strong move in the U.S. follows a day in the Europe where retail names are beating out all sectors in the Stoxx Europe 600.
    • Select retail gainers: Ascena Retail Group (ASNA +5.8%), Gap (GPS +3%), Buckle (BKE +6.2%), Tilly's (TLYS +3.9%), Office Depot (ODP +4.2%), Finish Line (FINL +4.5%), Stein Mart (SMRT +3.7%), Cato (CATO +4.1%) and Francesca's (FRAN +3.4%), Guess (GES +4.2%), Tuesday Morning (TUES +1.6%), Rite Aid (RAD +3.3%) and Boot Barn (BOOT +2.3%).
    • Previously: Five Below +11% as organic growth remains on track (March 23)
    • Previously: PVH up 7% as it beats in Q4, extends buyback (March 22)
    • The S&P Retail ETF (NYSEARCA:XRT) is up 1.64%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 3 Comments
  • INSY

    DEA categorizes Insys' Syndros Schedule II, U.S. market launch planned for H2; shares ahead 7%

    • Insys Therapeutics (INSY +7.2%) announces that the DEA has issued a preliminary rule placing Syndros (dronabinol oral solution) in Schedule II of the Controlled Substances Act. Schedule II drugs are ones with a high potential for abuse (e.g., pharmaceutical narcotics, morphine, opium and codeine).
    • The DEA's action clears the way for the commercial launch in the U.S., pending final labeling.
    • The FDA approved the product in July 2016 for the treatment of anorexia-associated weight loss in AIDS patients and chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting in patients who failed to respond to conventional antiemetic treatments.
    • Syndros is a liquid formulation of the pharmaceutical cannabinoid, dronabinol, a synthetic version of tetrahydrocannabinol (THC).
    • Previously: FDA approves Insys Therapeutics' Syndros for anorexia weight loss and CINV; shares ahead 21% premarket (July 5, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 3 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 am

    • Gainers: HTGM +92%. FLXN +34%. SSH +18%. CGIX +16%. VBLT +15%.
    • Losers: CERU -25%. TNDM -24%. ATEC -17%. HTBX -15%. INNL -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • FLXN

    Flexion spikes 26% on pending Sanofi takeover

    • Flexion Therapeutics (FLXN +26.1%) jumps on almost triple normal volume on the news that Sanofi (SNY +0.6%) will acquire the Boston area-based biotech for more than $1B in cash. Sources close to the matter say Flexion's board has agreed to accept a bid in the "mid-thirties."
    • Flexion's osteoarthritis of the knee candidate Zilretta is currently under FDA review.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 8 Comments
  • HUM

    House Speaker Ryan postpones news conference on AHCA vote on apparent last-minute push for votes; hospital shares rally

    • Hospital stocks perk up on investor optimism that Republicans may not have the votes in the House to pass the American Health Care Act (AHCA). Speaker Paul Ryan has postponed his planned 11:30 am ET news conference until 3:30 pm ET signaling that more votes may be needed for passage.
    • Related tickers: (HUM -0.1%)(HCA +1.4%)(THC +3.5%)(CYH +3.7%)(LPNT +0.2%)(SEM +2.9%)(SSY -1.1%)(QHC +1.1%)
    • Update: Bloomberg reports that the Speaker has postponed the press conference a second time.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 47 Comments
  • CLD

    Cloud Peak upgraded at FBR; Peabody’s emergence may boost coal valuations

    • Cloud Peak Energy (CLD +2%) is upgraded to Market Perform from Underperform with a $4 price target at FBR, which says the stock's valuation is fair compared to its outlook for the timing and extent of a potential recovery.
    • The firm says CLD management has done a fine job repositioning the company, from restructuring its export obligations to addressing the bonding questions to issuing equity and redeeming debt; however, CLD's exposure to volatile seaborne pricing remains a key uncertainty.
    • FBR also thinks Peabody Energy’s (BTUUQ) emergence from bankruptcy is bullish for the broader coal sector (NYSEARCA:KOL), as the move could attract more liquidity and long-term capital to the industry, which remains in gradual cyclical recovery even as long-term pressures remain.
    • Arch Coal (ARCH -2.1%) is FBR's top stock in the group, given its exposure to both met and thermal prices and its low-cost production profile.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 9 Comments

  • Natural gas futures pares gains post inventory draw

    • EIA Natural Gas Inventory: -150 Bcf vs. -150 Bcf consensus, -53 Bcf last week.
    • Futures +0.43% to $3.025.
    • ETFs: UNG, DGAZ, UGAZ, BOIL, GAZ, KOLD, UNL, DCNG
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 22 Comments
  • CS

    Credit Suisse down more than 3% on capital raise report

    • According to Bloomberg, the lender is mulling a CHF3B share sale.
    • CS -3.1%
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • CHL

    China Mobile -3.4% as dividend boost doesn't materialize

    • China Mobile (NYSE:CHL) is 3.4% lower in U.S. trading after an earnings report that featured industry-leading revenue growth but failed to deliver a hoped-for dividend boost.
    • The company is touting an increased dividend payout ratio (2016 full-year ratio to 46%), enough to offset renminbi devaluation, but leaving forward yield around the 3% range.
    • EBITDA rose nearly 7% to 256.7B yuan, and basic earnings per share were up just 0.2%.
    • Revenue growth was 6%, and 6.7% from telecom services (a five-year high).
    • Mobile customers rose 2.7% to 848.9M; of those, 4G customers rose 71.3% to 535.04M.
    • Shares closed down 3.4% in Hong Kong.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM | 3 Comments
  • PENN

    Penn National Gaming rallies after guidance update

    • Shares of Penn National Gaming (PENN +7.4%) race higher after the company sets Q1 guidance ahead of estimates.
    • Penn expects Q1 revenue of $770M to $771M vs. $761M prior and $760M consensus. EBITDA of $222M to $223M is seen vs. $209M consensus.
    • Shares are now up 20% YTD.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • ATEC

    Alphatec secures $18.9M capital raise; shares down 15%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Alphatec Holdings (ATEC -14.6%) slips on light volume on the heels of its announcement of a private placement of common stock, Series A Convertible Preferred Stock and warrants raising $18.9M in capital. Buyers are healthcare-focused institutional investors, company directors and executives and others. Closing date is March 28.
    • The deal includes the sale of 1,809,628 common shares at $2, 15,245 Series A shares (convertible into ~7.6M common shares) and warrants to purchase up to ~9.4M common shares at $2.00.
    • Alphatec executives and directors have agreed to buy $2.35M of Series A shares, convertible into ~1.175M common shares and warrants to purchase up to 1.175M common shares at $2.00.
    • Yesterday's close was $2.68.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 2 Comments
  • SVU

    SuperValu spikes after glowing RBC call

    • Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) is up 10.03% after RBC Capital upgrades the grocery store stock to Outperform.
    • "With easing deflation/eventual inflation, a very strong wholesale win pipeline, and under-appreciated real estate portfolio, we believe SVU is very attractive," writes analyst William Kirk.
    • It's not too late to jump on RBC's bull call as the firm's price target of $6 implies +70% upside potential.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 2 Comments
  • ATOS

    Enrollment underway in Atossa's early-stage study of breast cancer candidate endoxifen; shares continue down move, off 8%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Atossa Genetics (ATOS -8.3%) has lost almost 36% in a week, a continuation of a multi-year downtrend during which it has lost 97% of its value. Today, it announced the start of enrollment in a Phase 1 study in Australia assessing the pharmacokinetics of breast cancer candidate endoxifen, an active metabolite of tamoxifen, the active ingredient in Nolvadex, formerly marketed by AstraZeneca (stopped manufacturing in June 2006).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • FIVE

    Five Below +11% as organic growth remains on track

    • Five Below (NASDAQ:FIVE) is up 10.86% after topping comparable sales (+1.0% vs. +0.9%) and EPS ($0.90 vs. $0.89) estimates by a slim margin.
    • Analysts say the rally is tied to some relief that the retailer didn't lower its guidance like many of its peers.
    • An important point with Five Below is that new stores continue to perform well amid what is almost universally called a "challenging" retail environment.
    • Loop Capital (Buy, $54 PT) says Five Below is one of the more compelling long-term organic growth stories in the retail sector. Jefferies (Buy, $55 PT) points to the effectiveness of TV ads as the store base broadens.
    • Sources: CNBC and Bloomberg
    • Previously: Five Below beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (March 22)
    • Previously: Five Below up 6% as store growth feeds Q4 beat (March 22)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • SCHL

    Scholastic -2% as loss widens in seasonally weak quarter

    • Scholastic (NASDAQ:SCHL) has come out of the open down 2% after a fiscal Q3 earnings miss where revenues declined in each segment and losses widened.
    • The company usually reports a loss in Q3 on lower revenues, but loss per share increased to $0.45 from a year-ago loss of $0.21/share.
    • It offset some of the revenue drop with planned cost controls.
    • Revenue by segment: Children's Book Publishing/Distribution, $199M (down 9%); Education, $60.1M (down 6%); International, $77.1M (down 6.3%; down 5% ex-currency).

    • Interpace Diagnostics Group (NASDAQ:IDXG) slips 6% premarket on increased volume in response to the deal it struck to restructure its $9.34M debt to RedPath.

  • AOLS

    BARDA ends funding for development of Aeolus Pharma's AEOL 10150 for radiation exposure

    • The U.S government's Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA) notifies Aeolus Pharmaceuticals (OTCPK:AOLS) that it will not exercise its additional options to fund the continued development of AEOL 10150 as a medical countermeasure for pulmonary injury associated with radiation exposure. It has invested over $30M to date under a five-year agreement valued as high as $118M.
    • Management is "stunned" by the decision and "vehemently disagrees" with BARDA's rationale for backing out while questioning the "integrity" of the process.
    • The company says it will continue developing the product for ideopathic pulmonary fibrosis and cancer.
    • AEOL 10150 is a broad spectrum catalytic antioxidant specifically designed to neutralize reactive oxygen and nitrogen species, thereby reducing oxidative stress, inflammation and tissue damage-signaling cascades resulting from radiation exposure.
    • Nasdaq does not report any premarket trading but stockholders should expect a substantial down move at the open.

    Egalet nabs four patents covering abuse-deterrent technology; shares ahead 5% premarket

    • Egalet (OTC:EGLT) is up 5% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement that it has been awarded four patents covering its abuse-deterrent Guardian technology.
    • In the U.S., the USPTO has issued Patent No. 9,549,899 covering pain med ARYMO ER (morphine sulfate) extended-release tablets for oral use only.
